alert.note: Alert for Clay; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Raleigh; Southeast Webster (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:53AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Nicholas, central Braxton, east central Raleigh, western Webster, central Clay and eastern Fayette Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 553 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Summersville to near Sandstone. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Summersville, Richwood, Rainelle, Sutton, Clay, Babcock State Park, Ansted, Gassaway, Addison (Webster Springs), Camden-On-gauley, Birch River, Craigsville, Camden On Gauley, Harrison, Cowen, Meadow Bridge, Flatwoods, Muddlety, Upper Glade and Boggs. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 51 and 71. Interstate 64 in West Virginia between mile markers 129 and 137. Route 19 between mile markers 20 and 68. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Clay; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Northwest Webster; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Southeast Raleigh; Southeast Webster
